body_content.explanation: a short thick nail with a flat top that is fixed into the bottom of boots or shoes to make them last longer :
examples: The shoes were rugged footwear with steel heels, toe irons, and hobnails.
The thick leather soles were attached to the uppers by hobnails.

body_content.explanation: a heavy boot or shoe that has nails fixed into the bottom to make it last longer:
examples: On his first day of work, he was provided with a brand new pair of hobnails.
"Don't scratch the floor with your hobnails," said Martha.
